New Records: Jason Heyward hit a go-ahead, two-run homer and made a dazzling defensive play as the Houston Astros beat the Seattle Mariners 4-3 on Tuesday night to clinch their fourth consecutive AL West championship.
Key Match Events: Jason Heyward hit a go-ahead, two-run homer in the bottom of the fifth inning
Kyle Tucker hit a solo home run in the fourth inning
Alex Bregman hit a solo home run in the first inning
Jason Heyward made a dazzling defensive play in the top of the fifth inning
Pre-Game Insights: Jason Heyward signed with the Astros last month after his release by the Dodgers and is filling in for Yordan Alvarez, who is out with a knee sprain
Post-Match Reflections: First-year Astros manager Joe Espada was overwhelmed as the final out was recorded and expressed pride in the team's resilience
Seattle manager Dan Wilson highlighted the importance of the team's continued fight for a wild card spot
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros clinched their fourth consecutive AL West championship
The Mariners dropped 2 1/2 games below the postseason cutoff in a crowded race for the final two American League wild cards
Framber Valdez (15-7) permitted eight hits and three runs in 5 2/3 innings for the win
